reviews.review_msg: awesome teacher!  Follows book closely so very consistent. Very knowledgeable and approachable. Tests are very clear and fair, no surprises at all.  Best class I've taken at SFU.  highly recomended!!

Great teacher! Lectures a lot from the book but really know what she is talking about.  Great to listen to someone who has so much knowlegde in her field and can tie in relevant example to everything.

Highlight of my semester. Some may not appreciate his teaching style as it's not clearcut facts to write down and memorize - you need to take good notes and understand it on a deeper level - but he does highlight what is importanttest material. Great discussion and different perspectives. Invest the timeopen your mind - so worth it!

Like many others stated, it's not always clear what he expects for the exams and assignment, so yeah, you need to actually study and know your stuff. At the same time he doesn't just want you to memorize and regurgitate, he's trying to get us to THINK. His lectures are AMAZING!

He is a great professor, he is extremely knowledgable, funny, personable and funny. However, the laid-back class that gives you a different ever-last perspective on Psyc comes with difficult tests and ambiguous paper assignments. I have taken both his adolescent development class and intro to psychopathology. Not easy but no memorizing!

He was amazing! Material was very interesting and he was clearly passionate about it. Tests were harder than you'd expect, based on his joking personality during lectures, but never unfair. Always open to questions.
